replies.bodyText:
Currently, I am checking for blank values that get passed into:
DB2ConnectOptions.setUser
DB2ConnectOptions.setPassword
DB2ConnectOptions.setDatabase
When DB2ConnectOptions.init runs, it fills in default values for user (root), pwd (blank) and DB (blank).  This causes test failures right away for the last two listed.  I could push the testing for blank values back to the parent (SqlConnectOptions), but they already check for null values (not blank) and I am concerned changing global stuff outside of DB2.  How would you recommend I proceed?
replies.author: gjwatts

replies.bodyText: I have removed the default user/password/schema values and removed the setting of them in the init method.
replies.author: gjwatts

timeline.bodyText: for user/pass/database lets just check the length of the string without calling trim() (whitespace may still be valid characters)
timeline.author: aguibert

timeline.bodyText: Lets include the actual error code received in the error message here and on line 44
timeline.author: aguibert

timeline.bodyText: is this test case intentionally ignored?
timeline.author: aguibert

timeline.bodyText: if you change the catch block to only catch a DB2Exception then you don't have to do the instanceof check and cast. If any other exception type was thrown it would miss the catch block and cause the test case to fail as expected
timeline.author: aguibert

replies.bodyText: also applies to a few other cases in this PR
replies.author: aguibert
